question: In which issue did Spider-Man make his first appearance?
answer: Spider-Man first appeared in Amazing Fantasy #15 (1962), created by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko. The issue told Peter Parker's origin, including Uncle Ben's death and the famous lesson about power and responsibility.

question: In which issue did the Fantastic Four first appear, launching the Marvel Universe?
answer: The Fantastic Four debuted in Fantastic Four #1 (1961), created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby. Reed Richards, Sue Storm, Johnny Storm, and Ben Grimm gained powers from cosmic rays during a space flight.

question: In which issue did the original X-Men first appear?
answer: The X-Men debuted in X-Men #1 (1963), featuring Cyclops, Marvel Girl (Jean Grey), Beast, Iceman, and Angel, led by Professor Charles Xavier against Magneto.

question: In which issue was the Hulk first introduced?
answer: The Hulk first appeared in The Incredible Hulk #1 (1962), created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby. Bruce Banner was transformed by a gamma bomb explosion.

question: In which issue did Thor make his Marvel Comics debut?
answer: Thor debuted in Journey into Mystery #83 (1962), created by Stan Lee, Larry Lieber, and Jack Kirby. Dr. Donald Blake discovered a walking stick in a cave that transformed him into the Norse God of Thunder.

question: In which issue did Iron Man first appear?
answer: Iron Man first appeared in Tales of Suspense #39 (1963), created by Stan Lee, Larry Lieber, Don Heck, and Jack Kirby. Tony Stark built his first suit of armor while held captive.

question: In which issue was Captain America revived in the modern Marvel Universe?
answer: Captain America was found frozen in ice and revived by the Avengers in Avengers #4 (1964). He had been in suspended animation since World War II.

question: In which issue did Black Panther make his first appearance?
answer: Black Panther (T'Challa) first appeared in Fantastic Four #52 (1966), created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby. He was the first Black superhero in mainstream American comics.

question: In which issue did Black Widow (Natasha Romanoff) first appear?
answer: Black Widow first appeared in Tales of Suspense #52 (1964), initially as a Russian spy antagonist to Iron Man before eventually defecting to become a hero.

question: In which issue did Wolverine make his first full appearance?
answer: Wolverine made his first full appearance in Incredible Hulk #181 (1974), fighting both the Hulk and the Wendigo. He had a brief cameo on the last page of Incredible Hulk #180.

question: In which issue did Storm first appear?
answer: Storm (Ororo Munroe) first appeared in Giant-Size X-Men #1 (1975), as part of the new international team of X-Men recruited by Professor Xavier.

question: In which issue did Nightcrawler first appear?
answer: Nightcrawler (Kurt Wagner) debuted in Giant-Size X-Men #1 (1975), the teleporting German mutant who joined the All-New, All-Different X-Men.

question: In which issue did Colossus first appear?
answer: Colossus (Piotr Rasputin) first appeared in Giant-Size X-Men #1 (1975), the Russian mutant with the ability to transform his body into organic steel.

question: In which issue did the Punisher make his first appearance?
answer: The Punisher (Frank Castle) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #129 (1974), initially as an antagonist hired to kill Spider-Man by the Jackal.

question: In which issue did Luke Cage first appear?
answer: Luke Cage first appeared in Luke Cage, Hero for Hire #1 (1972), created by Archie Goodwin, John Romita Sr., and George Tuska. He was the first Black superhero to headline his own comic.

question: In which issue did Iron Fist first appear?
answer: Iron Fist (Danny Rand) first appeared in Marvel Premiere #15 (1974), created by Roy Thomas and Gil Kane.

question: In which issue did Blade the Vampire Hunter first appear?
answer: Blade first appeared in Tomb of Dracula #10 (1973), created by Marv Wolfman and Gene Colan. He was introduced as a supporting character hunting Dracula.

question: In which issue did Ghost Rider (Johnny Blaze) first appear?
answer: Ghost Rider (Johnny Blaze) first appeared in Marvel Spotlight #5 (1972), created by Roy Thomas, Gary Friedrich, and Mike Ploog.

question: In which issue did Elektra first appear?
answer: Elektra Natchios first appeared in Daredevil #168 (1981), created by Frank Miller. She was introduced as Matt Murdock's college girlfriend turned deadly assassin.

question: In which issue did She-Hulk first appear?
answer: She-Hulk (Jennifer Walters) first appeared in Savage She-Hulk #1 (1980), created by Stan Lee and John Buscema. She gained her powers via an emergency blood transfusion from her cousin Bruce Banner.

question: In which issue did Carol Danvers first appear as Ms. Marvel?
answer: Carol Danvers first appeared as Ms. Marvel in Ms. Marvel #1 (1977), though she had previously appeared as a non-powered character in Marvel Super-Heroes #13 (1968).

question: In which issue did Kamala Khan first appear as Ms. Marvel?
answer: Kamala Khan first appeared in Captain Marvel #14 (2013) in a cameo, with her first full appearance in Ms. Marvel #1 (2014), created by G. Willow Wilson, Sana Amanat, and Adrian Alphona.

question: In which issue did Miles Morales first appear as Spider-Man?
answer: Miles Morales first appeared in Ultimate Fallout #4 (2011), following the death of Peter Parker in the Ultimate Universe. He then starred in Ultimate Comics Spider-Man #1 (2011).

question: In which issue did Thanos first appear?
answer: Thanos first appeared in Iron Man #55 (1973), created by Jim Starlin. He was introduced alongside Drax the Destroyer and the concept of the Blood Brothers.

question: In which issue did Galactus and the Silver Surfer first appear?
answer: Galactus and the Silver Surfer first appeared in Fantastic Four #48 (1966), the beginning of the legendary Galactus Trilogy by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby.

question: In which issue were the Inhumans fully introduced?
answer: The Inhumans (Black Bolt, Medusa, Crystal, Gorgon, Karnak, Triton, and Maximus) were fully introduced in Fantastic Four #45 (1965), though Medusa had appeared earlier as a member of the Frightful Four.

question: In which issue did Doctor Strange first appear?
answer: Doctor Strange first appeared in Strange Tales #110 (1963), created by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko. Stephen Strange was introduced as the Master of the Mystic Arts.

question: In which issue did Daredevil first appear?
answer: Daredevil (Matt Murdock) first appeared in Daredevil #1 (1964), created by Stan Lee and Bill Everett. Blinded by radioactive material as a child, his other senses were enhanced to superhuman levels.

question: In which issue did Hawkeye first appear?
answer: Hawkeye (Clint Barton) first appeared in Tales of Suspense #57 (1964), initially as a villain inspired by Iron Man but manipulated by Black Widow.

question: In which issue did the Vision first appear?
answer: The Vision (the android Avenger) first appeared in Avengers #57 (1968), created by Ultron to destroy the Avengers but who turned against his creator.

question: In which issue did Scarlet Witch and Quicksilver first appear?
answer: Scarlet Witch (Wanda Maximoff) and Quicksilver (Pietro Maximoff) first appeared in X-Men #4 (1964) as members of Magneto's Brotherhood of Evil Mutants.

question: In which issue did Nick Fury first appear?
answer: Nick Fury first appeared in Sgt. Fury and His Howling Commandos #1 (1963) as a World War II soldier, created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby.
source_issue: Sgt. Fury and His Howling Commandos #1 (1963)

question: In which issue did Ant-Man (Hank Pym) first appear?
answer: Hank Pym first appeared in Tales to Astonish #27 (1962) as a scientist, and then became Ant-Man in Tales to Astonish #35 (1962), created by Stan Lee, Larry Lieber, and Jack Kirby.

question: In which issue did the Wasp first appear?
answer: The Wasp (Janet Van Dyne) first appeared in Tales to Astonish #44 (1963), created by Stan Lee, H.E. Huntley (Ernie Hart), and Jack Kirby. She became Hank Pym's partner and a founding Avenger.

question: In which issue did Namor the Sub-Mariner first appear in the Silver Age?
answer: Namor was revived in the Silver Age in Fantastic Four #4 (1962). He had originally appeared in Marvel Comics #1 (1939) during the Golden Age.

question: In which issue did Adam Warlock first appear?
answer: The character who would become Adam Warlock was first created as 'Him' in Fantastic Four #66-67 (1967) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby. He was later given the name Adam Warlock in Marvel Premiere #1 (1972).

question: In which issue did Cable first appear?
answer: Cable first appeared in New Mutants #87 (1990), created by Rob Liefeld and Louise Simonson. He was later revealed to be Nathan Summers, the son of Cyclops and Madelyne Pryor.

question: In which issue did Deadpool first appear?
answer: Deadpool (Wade Wilson) first appeared in New Mutants #98 (1991), created by Rob Liefeld and Fabian Nicieza, as a mercenary hired to attack Cable and the New Mutants.

question: In which issue did Venom (the symbiote with Eddie Brock) first appear?
answer: Venom (Eddie Brock bonded with the alien symbiote) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #300 (1988), created by David Michelinie and Todd McFarlane. The black symbiote itself first appeared in Secret Wars #8 (1984).

question: In which issue did Carnage first appear?
answer: Carnage (Cletus Kasady) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #361 (1992), created by David Michelinie and Mark Bagley. The Carnage symbiote was an offspring of the Venom symbiote.

question: In which issue did Gambit first appear?
answer: Gambit (Remy LeBeau) first appeared in Uncanny X-Men #266 (1990), created by Chris Claremont and Jim Lee.

question: In which issue did Bishop first appear?
answer: Bishop (Lucas Bishop) first appeared in Uncanny X-Men #282 (1991), created by Whilce Portacio and Jim Lee. He was a time-traveling mutant from a dystopian future.

question: In which issue did Psylocke first appear?
answer: Betsy Braddock first appeared in Captain Britain #8 (1976), created by Chris Claremont and Herb Trimpe, in the UK Marvel series. She later joined the X-Men in Uncanny X-Men #213 (1987).

question: In which issue did Moon Knight first appear?
answer: Moon Knight (Marc Spector) first appeared in Werewolf by Night #32 (1975), created by Doug Moench and Don Perlin, initially as a mercenary antagonist.

question: In which issue did Jessica Jones first appear?
answer: Jessica Jones first appeared in Alias #1 (2001), created by Brian Michael Bendis and Michael Gaydos as part of the mature-readers MAX imprint.

question: In which issue did the Sentry first appear?
answer: The Sentry (Robert Reynolds) first appeared in The Sentry #1 (2000), created by Paul Jenkins and Jae Lee, presented as a 'forgotten' Silver Age hero whose existence had been erased from memory.

question: In which issue did Black Bolt first speak, and what were the consequences?
answer: Black Bolt's devastating voice was first demonstrated in Fantastic Four #59 (1967), where even a whisper from him unleashed tremendous destructive force, establishing why he remains perpetually silent.

question: In which issue did the Kree alien race first appear?
answer: The Kree first appeared in Fantastic Four #65 (1967), created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, with the introduction of Ronan the Accuser and Kree Sentry #459.

question: In which issue did the Skrulls first appear?
answer: The shape-shifting Skrulls first appeared in Fantastic Four #2 (1962), in one of the earliest issues of Marvel's flagship title, created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby.

question: In which issue did Shang-Chi first appear?
answer: Shang-Chi first appeared in Special Marvel Edition #15 (1973), created by Steve Englehart and Jim Starlin, introduced as the son of Fu Manchu and a master of kung fu.

question: In which issue did Gwen Stacy die?
answer: Gwen Stacy died in Amazing Spider-Man #121 (1973), 'The Night Gwen Stacy Died,' when the Green Goblin (Norman Osborn) threw her off the George Washington Bridge. The Green Goblin died in the following issue, #122.

question: In which issue did Jean Grey die as Dark Phoenix?
answer: Jean Grey, as Dark Phoenix, died by her own hand in Uncanny X-Men #137 (1980), the conclusion of the Dark Phoenix Saga by Chris Claremont and John Byrne.

question: In which issue was Jean Grey revealed to be alive and separate from the Phoenix Force?
answer: Jean Grey was found alive in a cocoon at the bottom of Jamaica Bay in Avengers #263 (1986) and Fantastic Four #286 (1986), retconning that the Phoenix Force had replaced her rather than being her.

question: In which issue was Captain America assassinated?
answer: Captain America (Steve Rogers) was assassinated on the courthouse steps in Captain America #25 (2007) by Ed Brubaker and Steve Epting, shot by Crossbones and a brainwashed Sharon Carter.

question: In which issue did Captain America return from the dead after his assassination?
answer: Steve Rogers returned in Captain America: Reborn #1-6 (2009-2010) by Ed Brubaker, revealed to have been trapped in a time loop by the Red Skull using a modified gun.

question: In which issue did the Human Torch (Johnny Storm) die?
answer: Johnny Storm died heroically holding back an endless wave of Annihilus's forces in the Negative Zone in Fantastic Four #587 (2011) by Jonathan Hickman.

question: In which issue did the Human Torch return from the dead?
answer: Johnny Storm returned in Fantastic Four #600 (2012) by Jonathan Hickman, having survived in the Negative Zone where he led a rebellion against Annihilus.

question: In which issue did Wolverine die?
answer: Wolverine died in Death of Wolverine #4 (2014) by Charles Soule and Steve McNiven, suffocating inside hardening adamantium after his healing factor had been lost.

question: In which issue did Captain Marvel (Mar-Vell) die?
answer: Captain Mar-Vell died of cancer in Marvel's first graphic novel, The Death of Captain Marvel (1982) by Jim Starlin. It was one of the first major permanent deaths in comics.

question: In which issue did Elektra die at the hands of Bullseye?
answer: Elektra was killed by Bullseye in Daredevil #181 (1982) by Frank Miller, impaled with her own sai. She later died in Matt Murdock's arms.

question: In which issue was Elektra resurrected?
answer: Elektra was resurrected by the Hand and later purified by Stone in Daredevil #190 (1983) by Frank Miller, though she disappeared and would not fully return for years.

question: In which issue did Professor X die at the hands of Cyclops?
answer: Professor Xavier was killed by a Phoenix-possessed Cyclops in Avengers vs. X-Men #11 (2012) by Brian Michael Bendis, Jason Aaron, and others.

question: In which issue was Bucky revealed to be alive as the Winter Soldier?
answer: Bucky Barnes was revealed to be alive as the brainwashed Soviet assassin the Winter Soldier in Captain America #1 (2005) by Ed Brubaker and Steve Epting, with the full reveal in Captain America #8 (2005).

question: In which issue did Colossus sacrifice himself to cure the Legacy Virus?
answer: Colossus sacrificed himself to release the airborne cure for the Legacy Virus in Uncanny X-Men #390 (2001) by Scott Lobdell and Salvador Larroca.

question: In which issue did Colossus return from his Legacy Virus death?
answer: Colossus was revealed to be alive in Astonishing X-Men #4 (2004) by Joss Whedon and John Cassaday, having been resurrected by the alien Ord of Breakworld.

question: In which issue did Thor die during Fear Itself?
answer: Thor died in battle against the Serpent (Cul Borson) in Fear Itself #7 (2011) by Matt Fraction and Stuart Immonen, fulfilling a prophecy that he would fall after nine steps.

question: In which issue did Peter Parker die in the Ultimate Universe?
answer: Ultimate Peter Parker died in Ultimate Spider-Man #160 (2011) by Brian Michael Bendis and Mark Bagley, sacrificing himself to save his family from the Green Goblin and the Sinister Six.

question: In which issue did the Green Goblin (Norman Osborn) die after killing Gwen Stacy?
answer: Norman Osborn was impaled by his own Goblin Glider in Amazing Spider-Man #122 (1973) while trying to kill Spider-Man, seemingly dying. He was later retconned as having survived.

question: In which issue did Norman Osborn return from the dead?
answer: Norman Osborn was revealed to be alive in Spider-Man #75 (1996) during the Clone Saga, having used an enhanced healing factor from the Goblin Formula to survive his impalement.

question: In which issue did Thanos first die in the comics?
answer: Thanos was turned to stone by Adam Warlock in Marvel Two-in-One Annual #2 (1977), in the culmination of Jim Starlin's original cosmic saga involving Warlock, Thanos, and the Cosmic Cube.

question: In which issue did Thanos return to life ahead of the Infinity Gauntlet storyline?
answer: Thanos was resurrected by Death herself in Silver Surfer #34 (1990) by Jim Starlin, setting up the Thanos Quest and Infinity Gauntlet stories.

question: In which issue did Thunderbird die?
answer: Thunderbird (John Proudstar) died in X-Men #95 (1975), killed in action during only his second mission with the X-Men when he refused to abandon an attack on Count Nefaria's escaping plane.

question: In which issue did Kraven the Hunter kill himself after burying Spider-Man alive?
answer: Kraven the Hunter committed suicide in Amazing Spider-Man #294 (1987), the conclusion of 'Kraven's Last Hunt' by J.M. DeMatteis and Mike Zeck, after proving he could defeat Spider-Man.

question: In which issue did the Scarlet Witch eliminate the mutant gene with 'No More Mutants'?
answer: Scarlet Witch depowered over 90% of the world's mutants by saying 'No more mutants' in House of M #7 (2005) by Brian Michael Bendis and Olivier Coipel. This was known as Decimation.

question: In which issue did Doctor Octopus take over Peter Parker's body and become the 'Superior Spider-Man'?
answer: Otto Octavius swapped minds with Peter Parker, effectively killing Peter in his dying body, in Amazing Spider-Man #700 (2012) by Dan Slott. Otto then became the Superior Spider-Man.

question: In which issue did Wolverine return from his death in the adamantium shell?
answer: Wolverine returned in Marvel Legacy #1 (2017) in a brief teaser, with his full return in Return of Wolverine #1 (2018) by Charles Soule and Steve McNiven.

question: In which issue did Cyclops die from Terrigen Mist exposure?
answer: Cyclops died from M-Pox caused by the Terrigen Mists in Death of X #1 (2016), though it was later revealed he had died earlier and Emma Frost psychically projected his image to inspire mutantkind.

question: In which issue was the Vision destroyed by the government and then rebuilt without emotions?
answer: The Vision was dismantled by a government task force in West Coast Avengers #43 (1989) by John Byrne, and rebuilt as an emotionless, all-white version.

question: In which issue did Nightcrawler die?
answer: Nightcrawler died in X-Force #26 (2010) by Craig Kyle, Chris Yost, and Mike Choi, sacrificing himself to save Hope Summers from Bastion during the Second Coming crossover.

question: In which issue was the Phoenix Force reborn through Jean Grey after her first death?
answer: Jean Grey was fully resurrected as a separate entity from the Phoenix in X-Factor #1 (1986) by Bob Layton and Jackson Guice, reuniting the original five X-Men.

question: In which issue did Hawkeye die during Avengers Disassembled?
answer: Hawkeye sacrificed himself in Avengers #502 (2004) by Brian Michael Bendis, flying a Kree ship into an invading force during the Scarlet Witch's reality-warping breakdown.

question: In which issue did Professor X seemingly die for the first time?
answer: Professor X first appeared to die in X-Men #42 (1968), seemingly killed by the mutant Grotesk. It was later revealed in X-Men #65 (1970) that the Changeling had taken Xavier's place.

question: In which issue did Spider-Man's clone Ben Reilly die (the first time)?
answer: Ben Reilly died in Spider-Man #75 (1996), dissolving into dust when impaled by the Green Goblin's glider, proving that he was actually the clone and Peter Parker was the original.

question: In which issue was Bucky Barnes originally presumed killed?
answer: Bucky was seemingly killed alongside Captain America in the retold wartime flashback in Avengers #4 (1964), when a drone plane exploded over the English Channel near the end of World War II.

question: In which issue did the Wasp die during Secret Invasion?
answer: Janet Van Dyne (the Wasp) died in Secret Invasion #8 (2008) by Brian Michael Bendis, when a Skrull bioweapon implanted in her turned her into a living bomb, and Thor had to destroy her to save everyone.

question: In which issue did Banshee (Sean Cassidy) die?
answer: Banshee died in X-Men: Deadly Genesis #2 (2006) by Ed Brubaker, when he was killed trying to stop a plane carrying Vulcan, Cyclops's previously unknown brother.

question: In which issue did Wolverine kill Jean Grey to save her from the Phoenix?
answer: Wolverine killed Jean Grey in New X-Men #148 (2003) by Grant Morrison and Phil Jimenez, during the Planet X storyline, to end the Phoenix's destructive rampage. She was not resurrected for over a decade.

question: In which issue did the Sentry rip Ares in half during the Siege of Asgard?
answer: The Sentry tore Ares (the God of War) in half in Siege #2 (2010) by Brian Michael Bendis and Olivier Coipel, one of the most shocking moments of the Dark Reign era.

question: In which issue did Aunt May die during 'The Gift' storyline... only to be revealed alive?
answer: Aunt May appeared to die in Amazing Spider-Man #400 (1995) in a touching death scene, but was later retconned as an actress replaced by Norman Osborn, with the real May revealed alive in Amazing Spider-Man #418 (1996).

question: In which issue did Magneto rip the adamantium from Wolverine's skeleton?
answer: Magneto used his magnetic powers to rip the adamantium out of Wolverine's body in X-Men #25 (1993) by Fabian Nicieza and Andy Kubert, during the Fatal Attractions crossover. Wolverine survived but was left with bone claws.

question: What is Doctor Doom's real name, and in which issue did he first appear?
answer: Victor Von Doom, ruler of Latveria, first appeared in Fantastic Four #5 (1962), created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby. He is widely regarded as Marvel's greatest villain.

question: In which issue did the Green Goblin's identity as Norman Osborn first become clear?
answer: The Green Goblin was revealed to be Norman Osborn in Amazing Spider-Man #39-40 (1966) by Stan Lee and John Romita Sr., in a landmark two-parter where the Goblin discovered Spider-Man's identity.

question: In which issue did Magneto first appear?
answer: Magneto debuted in X-Men #1 (1963) as the X-Men's very first adversary, attacking a military base at Cape Citadel with his magnetic powers.

question: In which issue did Loki first appear as Thor's adversary?
answer: Loki, the God of Mischief, first appeared in Journey into Mystery #85 (1962) by Stan Lee, Larry Lieber, and Jack Kirby, establishing the sibling rivalry that would define Thor's mythology.

question: In which issue did the Red Skull first appear in the Silver Age Marvel continuity?
answer: The Red Skull returned in Tales of Suspense #66 (1965) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, re-establishing Captain America's greatest nemesis for the modern Marvel era.

question: In which issue did the Kingpin first appear?
answer: The Kingpin (Wilson Fisk) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #50 (1967) by Stan Lee and John Romita Sr., the same issue where Peter Parker famously threw his Spider-Man costume in a trash can.

question: In which issue did Ultron first appear?
answer: Ultron first appeared (disguised as the Crimson Cowl) in Avengers #54 (1968) by Roy Thomas and John Buscema, with his full reveal in Avengers #55. He was created by Hank Pym.

question: In which issue did Kang the Conqueror first appear?
answer: Kang the Conqueror first appeared in Avengers #8 (1964) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, a time-traveling warlord from the 30th century who would become one of the Avengers' greatest foes.

question: In which issue did Doctor Octopus first appear?
answer: Doctor Octopus (Otto Octavius) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #3 (1963) by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko, a nuclear physicist fused with four mechanical tentacles in a lab accident.

question: In which issue did Apocalypse first appear?
answer: Apocalypse (En Sabah Nur) first appeared in X-Factor #6 (1986) by Louise Simonson and Jackson Guice, revealed to be one of the oldest and most powerful mutants in history.

question: In which issue did Mystique first appear?
answer: Mystique (Raven Darkholme) first appeared in Ms. Marvel #16 (1978) by Chris Claremont and Jim Mooney, the shape-shifting mutant who would become a recurring X-Men antagonist.

question: In which issue did Sabretooth first appear?
answer: Sabretooth (Victor Creed) first appeared in Iron Fist #14 (1977) by Chris Claremont and John Byrne, initially as an Iron Fist villain before becoming Wolverine's arch-nemesis.

question: In which issue did the Mandarin first appear?
answer: The Mandarin first appeared in Tales of Suspense #50 (1964) by Stan Lee and Don Heck, as Iron Man's primary archenemy wielding ten alien rings of power.

question: In which issue did Taskmaster first appear?
answer: Taskmaster first appeared in Avengers #195 (1980) by David Michelinie and George Perez, a mercenary with 'photographic reflexes' who can mimic any physical movement he observes.

question: In which issue did MODOK first appear?
answer: MODOK (Mental Organism Designed Only for Killing) first appeared in Tales of Suspense #94 (1967) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, as a creation of the evil science organization AIM.

question: In which issue did Baron Zemo (Helmut Zemo) first appear?
answer: Helmut Zemo, son of the original Baron Zemo, first appeared in Captain America #168 (1973) by Tony Isabella and Sal Buscema, seeking revenge for his father's death.

question: In which issue did Mephisto first appear?
answer: Mephisto first appeared in Silver Surfer #3 (1968) by Stan Lee and John Buscema, a demon lord modeled after the literary Mephistopheles who tempts and torments heroes.

question: In which issue did Dormammu first appear?
answer: Dormammu first appeared in Strange Tales #126 (1964) by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko, as the ruler of the Dark Dimension and Doctor Strange's most powerful mystical adversary.

question: In which issue did the Vulture first appear?
answer: The Vulture (Adrian Toomes) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #2 (1963) by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko, an elderly inventor with a winged harness who became one of Spider-Man's earliest foes.

question: In which issue did Electro first appear?
answer: Electro (Max Dillon) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #9 (1964) by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko, a lineman who gained electrical powers after being struck by lightning while working on power lines.

question: In which issue did Mysterio first appear?
answer: Mysterio (Quentin Beck) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #13 (1964) by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko, a special effects expert and stunt man who used illusions and tricks to commit crimes.

question: In which issue did Kraven the Hunter first appear?
answer: Kraven the Hunter (Sergei Kravinoff) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #15 (1964) by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko, a big-game hunter who considered Spider-Man the ultimate prey.

question: In which issue did the Sandman first appear?
answer: The Sandman (William Baker/Flint Marko) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #4 (1963) by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko, a criminal who gained the ability to turn his body into sand.

question: In which issue did the Rhino first appear?
answer: The Rhino (Aleksei Sytsevich) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #41 (1966) by Stan Lee and John Romita Sr., a dim-witted thug bonded to an artificial rhino hide exoskeleton.

question: In which issue did the Scorpion first appear?
answer: The Scorpion (Mac Gargan) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #20 (1965) by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko, a private investigator mutated by J. Jonah Jameson's funded experiment to create a Spider-Man predator.

question: In which issue did the Lizard first appear?
answer: The Lizard (Dr. Curt Connors) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #6 (1963) by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko, a scientist who transformed after using lizard DNA in a formula to regrow his lost arm.

question: In which issue did Hela first appear?
answer: Hela, the Asgardian Goddess of Death, first appeared in Journey into Mystery #102 (1964) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, ruler of Hel and Niflheim.

question: In which issue did the Enchantress first appear?
answer: The Enchantress (Amora) first appeared in Journey into Mystery #103 (1964) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, an Asgardian sorceress who frequently schemed against Thor.

question: In which issue did the Absorbing Man first appear?
answer: The Absorbing Man (Carl 'Crusher' Creel) first appeared in Journey into Mystery #114 (1965) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, granted the power to absorb the properties of anything he touches by Loki.

question: In which issue did the Wrecker first appear?
answer: The Wrecker (Dirk Garthwaite) first appeared in Thor #148 (1968) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, a common thug who accidentally received Asgardian power from Karnilla the Norn Queen.

question: In which issue did Doctor Doom first steal the Silver Surfer's Power Cosmic?
answer: Doctor Doom stole the Silver Surfer's Power Cosmic in Fantastic Four #57-60 (1966), becoming one of the most powerful beings on Earth before being tricked into losing the power.

question: In which issue did Doctor Doom steal the Beyonder's power during Secret Wars?
answer: Doctor Doom stole the Beyonder's near-omnipotent power in Marvel Super Heroes Secret Wars #10 (1985) by Jim Shooter and Mike Zeck, briefly becoming a god before losing control.

question: In which issue did Annihilus first appear?
answer: Annihilus first appeared in Fantastic Four Annual #6 (1968) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, the insectoid ruler of the Negative Zone wielding the Cosmic Control Rod.

question: In which issue did Thanos first acquire all six Infinity Gems?
answer: Thanos completed his collection of all six Infinity Gems in Thanos Quest #2 (1990) by Jim Starlin and Ron Lim, taking the final gems from the cosmic Elders of the Universe.

question: In which issue did Thanos snap his fingers and kill half the universe?
answer: Thanos snapped his fingers while wearing the Infinity Gauntlet and killed half of all living beings in the universe in Infinity Gauntlet #1 (1991) by Jim Starlin and George Perez.

question: In which issue did Norman Osborn form the Dark Avengers?
answer: Norman Osborn assembled the Dark Avengers, a team of villains posing as heroes, in Dark Avengers #1 (2009) by Brian Michael Bendis and Mike Deodato, including Bullseye as 'Hawkeye' and Venom as 'Spider-Man'.

question: In which issue did the Hobgoblin first appear?
answer: The Hobgoblin first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man #238 (1983) by Roger Stern and John Romita Jr., discovering one of Norman Osborn's hidden weapons caches and adopting a modified Green Goblin identity.

question: In which issue did Galactus first attempt to devour Earth?
answer: Galactus first came to Earth to consume it in Fantastic Four #48-50 (1966) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, known as the Galactus Trilogy. He was ultimately driven away by Reed Richards using the Ultimate Nullifier.

question: In which issue did Bullseye kill Elektra?
answer: Bullseye killed Elektra in Daredevil #181 (1982) by Frank Miller, impaling her on her own sai. It was one of the most famous villain victories in Marvel history.

question: In which issue did the Kingpin take over Daredevil's life in the 'Born Again' storyline?
answer: The Kingpin systematically destroyed Matt Murdock's life after learning his identity in Daredevil #227 (1986) by Frank Miller and David Mazzucchelli, beginning the legendary 'Born Again' arc.

question: In which issue did Onslaught first fully appear?
answer: Onslaught, the psionic entity born from the merged consciousness of Professor X and Magneto, first fully appeared in X-Men #53 (1996) by Mark Waid and Andy Kubert.

question: In which issue did the Super-Skrull first appear?
answer: The Super-Skrull (Kl'rt) first appeared in Fantastic Four #18 (1963) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, a Skrull warrior engineered to possess all four powers of the Fantastic Four.

question: In which issue did Doctor Doom become God Emperor Doom?
answer: Doctor Doom became God Emperor Doom, ruler of Battleworld, in Secret Wars #1 (2015) by Jonathan Hickman and Esad Ribic, having used the power of the Beyonders to save fragments of the dying multiverse.

question: What was Doctor Doom's 'Unthinkable' act in Mark Waid's Fantastic Four run?
answer: In Fantastic Four #500 (2003) by Mark Waid and Mike Wieringo, Doom sacrificed his childhood love Valeria to demons for mystical power, then trapped Franklin Richards in Hell, representing Doom at his most ruthless.

question: In which issue did the Executioner (Skurge) make his heroic last stand at Gjallerbru?
answer: Skurge the Executioner sacrificed himself holding the bridge at Gjallerbru against Hela's forces in Thor #362 (1985) by Walt Simonson, one of the most celebrated heroic villain redemption moments in Marvel history.

question: Who were the founding members of the Avengers, and in which issue did they form?
answer: The Avengers formed in Avengers #1 (1963), with founding members Iron Man, Thor, Hulk, Ant-Man (Hank Pym), and the Wasp (Janet Van Dyne), uniting to battle Loki.

question: Who were the original five X-Men?
answer: The original five X-Men introduced in X-Men #1 (1963) were Cyclops (Scott Summers), Marvel Girl (Jean Grey), Beast (Hank McCoy), Iceman (Bobby Drake), and Angel (Warren Worthington III).

question: Who were the members of the All-New, All-Different X-Men introduced in Giant-Size X-Men #1?
answer: Giant-Size X-Men #1 (1975) by Len Wein and Dave Cockrum introduced the new team: Wolverine, Storm, Nightcrawler, Colossus, Banshee, Thunderbird, and Sunfire, with Cyclops as the returning member.

question: Who were the four members of the Fantastic Four, and how did they get their powers?
answer: Reed Richards (Mr. Fantastic), Sue Storm (Invisible Girl), Johnny Storm (Human Torch), and Ben Grimm (Thing) gained powers from cosmic rays during a space flight in Fantastic Four #1 (1961).

question: In which issue did the Defenders first appear as a team?
answer: The Defenders (Doctor Strange, Hulk, and Namor) first appeared together as the 'non-team' in Marvel Feature #1 (1971) by Roy Thomas and Ross Andru.

question: In which issue did the New Mutants first appear?
answer: The New Mutants first appeared in Marvel Graphic Novel #4 (1982) by Chris Claremont and Bob McLeod, featuring young mutants Cannonball, Mirage, Wolfsbane, Sunspot, and Karma.

question: In which issue did X-Force first appear under that name?
answer: X-Force #1 (1991) by Rob Liefeld and Fabian Nicieza launched the team, with Cable leading former New Mutants members into a more militant mutant strike force.

question: In which issue were the Thunderbolts revealed to be the Masters of Evil in disguise?
answer: The Thunderbolts were shockingly revealed to be Baron Zemo's Masters of Evil in disguise in Thunderbolts #1 (1997) by Kurt Busiek and Mark Bagley, in one of the greatest twist endings in Marvel history.

question: In which issue did the New Warriors first appear?
answer: The New Warriors debuted in Thor #411 (1989) by Tom DeFalco and Ron Frenz, featuring Night Thrasher, Nova, Namorita, Marvel Boy, Speedball, and Firestar.

question: In which issue did Alpha Flight first appear?
answer: Alpha Flight first appeared in Uncanny X-Men #120 (1979) by Chris Claremont and John Byrne, as Canada's premier superhero team sent to retrieve Wolverine from the X-Men.

question: Who were the original Guardians of the Galaxy from the 31st century?
answer: The original Guardians of the Galaxy debuted in Marvel Super-Heroes #18 (1969) by Arnold Drake and Gene Colan, featuring Vance Astro, Charlie-27, Martinex, and Yondu from the 31st century.

question: In which issue did the modern Guardians of the Galaxy (Star-Lord's team) first form?
answer: The modern Guardians of the Galaxy (Star-Lord, Rocket Raccoon, Groot, Drax, Gamora, Adam Warlock, and others) formed in Guardians of the Galaxy #1 (2008) by Dan Abnett and Andy Lanning.

question: In which issue did the Illuminati first appear?
answer: The Illuminati (Iron Man, Doctor Strange, Reed Richards, Namor, Black Bolt, and Professor X) were revealed to have been meeting in secret in New Avengers: Illuminati #1 (2006) by Brian Michael Bendis and Alex Maleev.

question: In which issue did the Young Avengers first appear?
answer: The Young Avengers debuted in Young Avengers #1 (2005) by Allan Heinberg and Jim Cheung, featuring Patriot, Asgardian (later Wiccan), Hulkling, and Iron Lad.

question: In which issue did the original Sinister Six first appear?
answer: The Sinister Six (Doctor Octopus, Vulture, Electro, Kraven, Mysterio, and Sandman) first appeared in Amazing Spider-Man Annual #1 (1964) by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko.

question: In which issue did the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants first appear?
answer: The Brotherhood of Evil Mutants first appeared in X-Men #4 (1964) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, led by Magneto and including Scarlet Witch, Quicksilver, Toad, and Mastermind.

question: In which issue did the Hellfire Club first appear in the X-Men?
answer: The Hellfire Club and its Inner Circle first appeared in Uncanny X-Men #129 (1980) by Chris Claremont and John Byrne, with Sebastian Shaw, Emma Frost, and Jason Wyngarde manipulating Jean Grey.

question: Who were the members of 'Cap's Kooky Quartet,' and when did they debut?
answer: Captain America's reformed Avengers lineup of Hawkeye, Scarlet Witch, and Quicksilver (all former villains) debuted in Avengers #16 (1965) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, with all founding members departing.

question: In which issue did the West Coast Avengers first form?
answer: The West Coast Avengers first appeared in West Coast Avengers #1 (1984 limited series) by Roger Stern and Bob Hall, led by Hawkeye with Mockingbird, Wonder Man, Tigra, and Iron Rhodey.

question: In which issue did the New Avengers first form after Avengers Disassembled?
answer: The New Avengers formed in New Avengers #1 (2005) by Brian Michael Bendis and David Finch, with Captain America, Iron Man, Spider-Man, Wolverine, Luke Cage, Spider-Woman, and the Sentry assembling after a Raft prison breakout.

question: In which issue did Excalibur first appear?
answer: Excalibur debuted in Excalibur Special Edition #1 (1988), also known as 'The Sword Is Drawn,' by Chris Claremont and Alan Davis, featuring Captain Britain, Meggan, Shadowcat, Nightcrawler, and Rachel Summers.

question: In which issue did the Future Foundation first appear?
answer: The Future Foundation was established in Fantastic Four #579 (2010) by Jonathan Hickman, as Reed Richards created a think tank of young geniuses including the Moloid children and Artie and Leech.

question: In which issue did the Krakoan-era mutant government form, with the Quiet Council?
answer: The Quiet Council of Krakoa was established in House of X #6 (2019) by Jonathan Hickman, with Xavier, Magneto, Apocalypse, Emma Frost, and others forming mutantkind's governing body.

question: In which issue did Power Pack first appear?
answer: Power Pack debuted in Power Pack #1 (1984) by Louise Simonson and June Brigman, featuring the four Power siblings (Alex, Julie, Jack, and Katie) who received alien powers from a dying Kymellian.

question: In which issue did the Invaders first appear as a World War II team?
answer: The Invaders (Captain America, Bucky, Namor, Human Torch, and Toro) first appeared as a named team in Invaders #1 (1975) by Roy Thomas and Frank Robbins, retroactively established as WWII's premier superhero team.

question: In which issue did the Fantastic Four's lineup first include She-Hulk as a member?
answer: She-Hulk replaced the Thing as a member of the Fantastic Four in Fantastic Four #265 (1984) by John Byrne, when Ben Grimm chose to stay on the Beyonder's Battleworld.

question: In which issue did the Champions of Los Angeles first appear?
answer: The Champions debuted in Champions #1 (1975) by Tony Isabella and Don Heck, featuring the unlikely team of Angel, Iceman, Hercules, Black Widow, and Ghost Rider.

question: In which issue did the Midnight Sons first assemble?
answer: The Midnight Sons assembled in Ghost Rider #31 (1992) by Howard Mackie, during the 'Rise of the Midnight Sons' crossover, featuring Ghost Rider, Blade, Morbius, Doctor Strange, and others against Lilith.

question: In which issue did the Starjammers first appear?
answer: The Starjammers, a band of space pirates led by Corsair (Cyclops's father Christopher Summers), first appeared in Uncanny X-Men #107 (1977) by Chris Claremont and Dave Cockrum.

question: In which issue did the Frightful Four first appear?
answer: The Frightful Four (Wizard, Sandman, Paste-Pot Pete/Trapster, and Medusa) first appeared in Fantastic Four #36 (1965) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, as the evil counterpart to the Fantastic Four.

question: In which issue did X-Statix (originally X-Force vol. 2) first appear?
answer: The celebrity mutant team originally called X-Force debuted in X-Force #116 (2001) by Peter Milligan and Mike Allred, later renamed X-Statix. It was a satirical take on fame and superheroics.

question: In which issue did the Avengers first fight Kang the Conqueror, and what was Kang's plan?
answer: The Avengers first fought Kang in Avengers #8 (1964) by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby. Kang traveled from the 30th century to conquer the 20th century, viewing it as a primitive era ripe for domination.

question: In which issue did Wonder Man first appear and join the Avengers?
answer: Wonder Man (Simon Williams) first appeared in Avengers #9 (1964) by Stan Lee and Don Heck, created by Baron Zemo to infiltrate and destroy the Avengers. He seemingly died sacrificing himself to save them.

question: In which issue did Luke Cage and Iron Fist first team up as Power Man and Iron Fist?
answer: Luke Cage and Iron Fist officially became partners in Power Man and Iron Fist #50 (1978), previously Power Man #50, by Chris Claremont and John Byrne.

question: In which issue did the Avengers face the Kree-Skrull War, and who wrote it?
answer: The Kree-Skrull War ran through Avengers #89-97 (1971-1972) by Roy Thomas and Neal Adams (among others), one of the first major epic crossover storylines in Marvel history, with Earth caught between two alien empires.

question: In which issue did the mutant island Krakoa first appear?
answer: Krakoa the living island first appeared in Giant-Size X-Men #1 (1975) by Len Wein and Dave Cockrum, as the threat that necessitated the formation of the new international X-Men team. It was later reimagined as the mutant homeland in House of X #1 (2019).

question: Who formed the original Wrecking Crew, and in which issue?
answer: The Wrecking Crew (Wrecker, Thunderball, Bulldozer, and Piledriver) first appeared as a team in Defenders #17 (1974) by Len Wein and Sal Buscema, when the Wrecker shared his Asgardian power with three fellow inmates.

question: In which issue did Hickman's Avengers roster first assemble?
answer: Jonathan Hickman's expanded Avengers roster debuted in Avengers #1 (2012) with Captain America and Iron Man recruiting a massive team including Captain Universe, Hyperion, Smasher, and others to face an Ex Nihilo threat on Mars.

question: In which issue did the Great Lakes Avengers first appear?
answer: The Great Lakes Avengers debuted in West Coast Avengers #46 (1989) by John Byrne, a comedic team featuring Mr. Immortal, Flatman, Big Bertha, Dinah Soar, and Doorman.

question: In which issue did Generation X first appear?
answer: Generation X debuted in Generation X #1 (1994) by Scott Lobdell and Chris Bachalo, featuring a new class of young mutants (Jubilee, Husk, Chamber, Synch, M, Skin, and Penance) trained by Banshee and Emma Frost at the Massachusetts Academy.
